page.title: 13FULLERTON VILLAGE AREA
page.content: THIS BRICK AND HUNG TILE MILL ON THE R.ANTON IS ON A DOMESDAY(1086) SITE AND HAS SLUICES TO DIVERT THE WATER UNDER THE EXISTING WATER WHEEL. THIS IS USED TO DRIVE A SAW, THE MILLSTONES HAVING BEEN REMOVED.EEL TRAPS BY THE SLUICES CATCH EELS IN AUGUST TO BE SMOKED AND SOLD IN LONDON. {FULLERTON JUNCTION}THIS DISUSED STATION ON THE SPRAT AND WINKLE LINE FROM ANDOVER TO SOUTHAMPTON IS A PRIVATE HOUSE AS ARE 2 OTHER RAILWAY HOUSES NEARBY. THE TRACK IS NOW USED BY THE {TEST WAY}, A FOOTPATH TO INKPEN BEACON.THE PLATFORMS ARE STILL VISIBLE, BUT THE TRACK HAS BEEN GRAVELLED. AT {FULLERTON MANOR} IS THE {ROMAN {MOSAIC}TAKEN FROM THE VILLA AT 367408
